page.title: 15A Day in My Life B'ham
page.content: My dad wakes me in the morning when he returns from his night shift at Lucas's where they make batteries for motor cars. Even though it is early many noises tell me the day has begun. The rush hour traffic, the sparrows chirping and next door's dog barking. I can hear mum getting my cereal ready for breakfast with our local radio station BRMB blaring through the house. After I have washed I dress for school in my blue uniform. As we leave the house the city traffic fills the air with noise and fumes. Mum hurries my little brother as she see's the number 31 bus coming down the road. Mum shows the driver her bus pass and puts 22pence into the ticket machine for us. We sit together downstairs because although you can see more on the top deck people smoke and the smell makes you feel sick.
